Patch Set 27:

(5 comments)
it is not clear as to what "pldm data" you are referring to here?
mentioned in commit msg.
Again could you please specify what data we are talking about here that PLDM stores and needs after BMC reboot?
mentioned in commit msg.

What editor do you use to write your commit messages? Can we configure it to hard-wrap at the appropriate width? For instance, in vim you can use gq to wrap the text:

https://vimhelp.org/change.txt.html#gq
done

Is there any specific need to have this function? Can we save the data using only
path, interface, property name, value format
removed since function is not required.
can we make this inline function?
Can we avoid this function and pass file path as a default parameter to getSerialize function, whose default value will be PERSISTENT_FILE
default PERSISTENT_FILE path is initialised as file path but to test the functionality using unit test need to add this function because file path is private in class.
done
Do you see any advantage of having the function to set the file path for testcases over the static file path?
there is no alternate solution to test the functionality.please suggest if you have any idea.
Is this used?
removed.
why do we need this?
Removed type.cpp since it has common data as util.cpp.

Can we reuse the variable defined at 
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/common/utils.hpp#L179
Removed redundant code and used existing code as suggested.
can you format this?
done.
Can we make it more readable by using alias from https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/common/utils.hpp#L193
removed redundant code as suggested.
can we have dummy values, rather than original paths?
Done
what happens wen we serialize a bad path? can we have a test case for that?

Serialize returns void so can't test bad path here.
instead passing required values and checking, is it working fine and we got the data what we stored.
typo
Done
can we add deserialize the good path test case?
Done

Please change it to 
conf_data.set_quoted('PERSISTENT_FILE', join_paths(package_localstatedir, 'persist'))
Did this work while testing? 😊
since FILE PATH is static, not using as suggested but in upcoming commits will change as per suggestion while testing.
I do not see the change in existing patch set. Also as mentioned above still testing is pending so marking this comment as unresolved
Done

Hi Kamal, since this is the infrastructure commit for storing the PLDM data as mentioned, can we have a separate commit for restoring the PLDM data information?
or we could add restore files in the same commit which would give us the whole infrastructure in a single commit.

I see the restore added in a commit on top of this which talks about CPU core store and restore. Rather can we have a commit split?
Can we add a error statement before we return?
Done
error statement ?
Done
error statement ?
this is not an error scenario, just checking the value and updating it, so no need any trace to print again n again.
not needed
Done
not needed
Done
add an error statement if needed?
this is not an error scenario, just checking the value is empty or not.
do you mean Dbus Object paths??
yes dbus object path.
does it mean, in absence of persistence file BMC reboot will fail?
no, if persistent file not present then core count and other vital information will not be restored in dbus properties and same information will not be visible to redfish.
redundant?
done

what pldm data are we storing ? is it dbus objects ? lets be specific. rather 

`Add support to persist pldm dbus objects`
how does this sound ?
Done

remove bullets and make this a paragraph.

also we are adding a new dependency cereal to pldm, we need a recipe change for this in meta-phosphor layer.

updated commit message as suggested.
bitbake is not failing
`Unit tests passed` , should be good enough.
Done
aligment in the comment does not seem right ? can you align it properly and also as its multiline , use /* */ instead.
Done
do we need an ordered_map ? or unordered would do ?
Done
remove full stop.
Done
exist
Done
use std::tie instead to initialize all the 3 values at once.

i tried to change but it's gives error bcz pldm_entity structure is packed structure and tie won't bind with packed field. for example:
std::tie(type) = entity.entity_type; gives error bcz of packed structure type.

other way around it won't make any much difference if i assign each value in different line or use tie to assign value at same time in single line.
can't this be done in the constructor ?
this data filled when getEntityTypes function is called and that function is part of deserialization commit, so can't move in constructor.
typo
Done
`const fs::path path{}` instead ?

not possible bcz default argument need some value to be considerred as default argument for function signature but if we define like this then it's considered as new empty variable and not considered as default argument.
`if(!path.empty())` ?
Done
const reference ?
Done
can't this be initialized in the constructor ?
Done
need an ordered map ?
Done
need to delete the /tmp file as well ? or leave it there ?
done
lets call it `pldm_store` instead. persist is too much generic need a pldm name in that for better reasons.
done
need to check for cereal dependency and break compilation if not found.
tried multiple time, bitbake is working without any issue

cereal dependency should not added here as well.

without these changes bitbake will fail.
tried multiple time, bitbake is working without any issue
do you want to change this to PLDM_STORE_FILE as well?
Done
Code looks good to me just one minor comment.
it will be good if it is indent formatted like other places.
Done

Can we get this commit message rephrased?  Try to focus on:

1. What capability are we adding.
2. Why are we adding it, with specific use cases.
3. How have we tested on a real system that this solves the problem.


PLDM storing this level of persistent data is really odd to add, and really needs justification that we're doing the right thing in terms of overall system design.
we need meta-phosphor commit which adds the same dependency , and this commit should be merged along with the meta-phosphor commit. otherwise openbmc build might be broken.

I arrived here because of a change in openbmc/openbmc that enabled cereal and tracked down where it was coming from.  Do we really want to use cereal?  I thought as a project we were generally moving away from that and shifting to using nlohmann-json directly?
Hope this explanation is fine: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/71387/comment/cb303f7a_af087538/
format
nit: it is good to give some meaningful name

nit: Can we change `innerMap` to `jsonInterfaceMap` for better readability?
Similarly for other json objects.
change to Camel case
Change to camel case
Do we still need `Cereal` Library?
